result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina G. Ross

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 4, 2022 at 04:30 pm.

2:28 PM Defendant Christina G. Ross appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney (Atty) Richard E. Bender appeared by video for Christina G. Ross.  District Attorney (DA) Cass W Cousins in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have not had their pretrial conference.
BY THE COURT: Parties to hold their pretrial conference no later than 11-04-2022 by 4:30 PM.
Parties to contact the Judge's JA and the Portage County JA Br 2 and clerk to schedule the next hearing.
2:45 PM Court in recess.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
Exhibit from Preliminary Hearing held on 09-16-2022
Exhibit List - Preliminary Hearing 09-16-2022
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:33 PM 
Defendant Christina G. Ross in court. Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richard Bender appears by zoom video for the defendant. Court appears by zoom video.
Cases 21CF34, 21CF462, 22CF347, 22CM47 are called and appearances are stated.
ADA Cassidy notes an error in the complaint and states the correction.
Court questions Atty Bender.
Atty Bender notes he has read the complaint and that the defendant waives reading.
Atty Bender states they are ready to proceed.

Officer Zachary Gartmann is sworn in by the clerk.
Direct exam by Atty Cassidy.
Exhibit P1 is marked for ADA Cassidy and references during examination.
Direct exam continues.
Court notes that the defendant was identified by the witness.
ADA Cassidy moves exhibit 1 into evidence.

BY THE COURT:
Exhibit 1 is received, subject to cross.

Cross exam by Atty Bender.
Objection by ADA Cassidy - Sustained.
Cross exam continues.
Objection by ADA Cassidy as to relevance of the questions - Sustained.
Witness is excused.

ADA Cassidy states reasons for probable cause and asks the court to bind the defendant over for trial.
Atty Bender states he doesn't not believe the State's burden has been met and provides reasoning.
Atty Bender requests a dismissal of the compliant.

Court states findings.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds probable cause to support the charges.
Defendant bound over for trial.

ADA Cassidy states that an amended information will be filed.
Atty Bender states he is comfortable moving forward with an arraignment.
Court is comfortable proceeding as well.

ARRAIGNMENT:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered on all counts.

BY THE COURT:  
Bond continued. 

Court inquires as to what should be scheduled next.
Atty Bender notes that a pre-trial conference should be set.

BY THE COURT:
Cases set for a status conference on 10-27-2022 at 2:30.
Parties are expected to pre-trial the cases prior to the status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Atty Richard Bender appointed

11:01 AM Attorney Richard E. Bender appeared by video for Christina G. Ross.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
All files heard: 21CF34, 21CF462, 22CF347, 22CM47

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victims not present.
Court reviews the files. 
 
Court questions the defendant regarding a valid mailing address.  Notices have been returned. 
Court questions the clerk. 
Clerk informs the court the address was incorrect in one of the files and updates that address. 

Atty Cassidy indicates 22CF347 needs a preliminary hearing scheduled.  Makes additional statements with regards to the disposition in these cases. 
Atty Bender makes statements to the court.  The public defender will appoint him on 22CF347 after meeting with the defendant to determine if she is still eligible. 
Court questions Atty Bender. 
Atty Bender agrees to have a preliminary hearing set. 
Parties do not object to the court appearing by zoom for the preliminary hearing on 22CF347.  All other files will be set for a status conference at that time. 

BY THE COURT: 
Defendant is to appear either by video or in person for identifying purposes.  Defendant is to contact the public defender's office to
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:53 PM Defendant Christina G. Ross in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.


BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on September 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Judge Galen Bayne-Allison assigned

No contact with J.S.S. and no 3rd party contact with the victim
Follow all open bond conditions

2:56 PM Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christina G. Ross in court. 

Bond has not been set.
State is in compliance with victim rights notification.
Record reflects that there is no response to the courts inquiry.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant wishes to be represented by counsel.
Defendant will continue to work the public defender's office in getting her current counsel appointed on this case.

State recommends a $1,000 bond with conditions as stated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Prosecutor. Date: August 22nd at 2:30 pm, Br 1.

Filed by the State:  Initial Appearance rescheduled to 08/22/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1 
(DA's Office to file a SUMMONS)
filed by the State
Initial Appearance set for August 8, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1
